algorithm_technique: Union-Find with prime factorization and sieve
problem_summary_simple: Determine if an array can be sorted by swapping elements with a GCD greater than 1.
problem_summary_technical: Use Union-Find to group numbers sharing prime factors. Check if elements in the original array belong to the same group as their sorted counterparts.
time_complexity: O(N log N + M log log M)
key_insights: Numbers can be swapped if they share a common prime factor.
The problem can be modeled as finding connected components in a graph where edges exist between numbers with GCD > 1.
Union-Find is efficient for managing these connected components.
